component.name: document
component.description: Documents are generated by facelets documents using tags in the http://jboss.com/products/seam/pdf namespace. Documents should always have the document tag at the root of the document. The document tag prepares Seam to generate a document into the DocumentStore and renders an HTML redirect to that stored content.

attribute.name: type
attribute.description: The type of the document to be produced. Valid values are PDF, RTF and HTML modes. Seam defaults to PDF generation, and many of the features only work correctly when generating PDF documents.

attribute.name: pageSize
attribute.description: The size of the page to be generate. The most commonly used values would be LETTER and A4. A full list of supported pages sizes can be found in com.lowagie.text.PageSize class. Alternatively, pageSize can provide the width and height of the page directly. The value "612 792", for example, is equivalent to the LETTER page size.

attribute.name: orientation
attribute.description: The orientation of the page. Valid values are portrait and landscape. In landscape mode, the height and width page size values are reversed.

attribute.name: margins
attribute.description: The left, right, top and bottom margin values.

attribute.name: marginMirroring
attribute.description: Indicates that margin settings should be reversed an alternating pages.

component.name: paragraph
component.description: Most uses of text should be sectioned into paragraphs so that text fragments can be flowed, formatted and styled in logical groups.

attribute.name: spacingBefore
attribute.description: The blank space to be inserted before the element.

attribute.name: spacingAfter
attribute.description: The blank space to be inserted after the element.

component.name: text
component.description: The text tag allows text fragments to be produced from application data using normal JSF converter mechanisms. It is very similar to the outputText tag used when rendering HTML documents.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: The value to be displayed. This will typically be a value binding expression.

component.name: font
component.description: The font tag defines the default font to be used for all text inside of it.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The font name, for example: COURIER, HELVETICA, TIMES-ROMAN, SYMBOL or ZAPFDINGBATS.

attribute.name: size
attribute.description: The point size of the font.

attribute.name: style
attribute.description: The font styles. Any combination of : NORMAL, BOLD, ITALIC, OBLIQUE, UNDERLINE, LINE-THROUGH

attribute.name: encoding
attribute.description: The character set encoding.

component.name: image
component.description: p:image inserts an image into the document. Images can be be loaded from the classpath or from the web application context using the value attribute. Resources can also be dynamically generated by application code. The imageData attribute can specify a value binding expression whose value is a java.awt.Image object.

attribute.name: value
attribute.description: A resource name or a method expression binding to an application-generated image.

attribute.name: rotation
attribute.description: The rotation of the image in degrees.

attribute.name: height
attribute.description: The height of the image.

attribute.name: width
attribute.description: The width of the image.

attribute.name: alignment
attribute.description: The alignment of the image. Seam PDF supports the following horizontal alignment values: left, right, center, justify and justifyall. The vertical alignment values are top, middle, bottom, and baseline.

attribute.name: alt
attribute.description: Alternative text representation for the image.

attribute.name: spacingBefore
attribute.description: The blank space to be inserted before the element.

attribute.name: spacingAfter
attribute.description: The blank space to be inserted after the element.

attribute.name: scalePercent
attribute.description: The scaling factor (as a percentage) to use for the image. This can be expressed as a single percentage value or as two percentage values representing separate x and y scaling percentages.

component.name: anchor
component.description: p:anchor defines clickable links from a document.

attribute.name: name
attribute.description: The name of an in-document anchor destination.

attribute.name: reference
attribute.description: The destination the link refers to. Links to other points in the document should begin with a "#". For example, "#link1" to refer to an anchor postion with a name of link1. Links may also be a full URL to point to a resource outside of the document.

component.name: header
component.description: The p:header and p:footer components provide the ability to place header and footer text on each page of a generated document, with the exception of the first page. Header and footer declarations should appear near the top of a document.

attribute.name: alignment
attribute.description: The alignment of the image. Seam PDF supports the following horizontal alignment values: left, right, center, justify and justifyall. The vertical alignment values are top, middle, bottom, and baseline.

attribute.name: backgroundColor
attribute.description: The background color of the header/footer box. Currently, only named colors are supported. They are: white, gray, lightgray, darkgray, black, red, pink, yellow, green, magenta, cyan and blue.

attribute.name: borderColor
attribute.description: The border color of the header/footer box. Individual border sides can be set using borderColorLeft, borderColorRight, borderColorTop and borderColorBottom. Currently, only named colors are supported. They are: white, gray, lightgray, darkgray, black, red, pink, yellow, green, magenta, cyan and blue.

attribute.name: borderColorBottom

attribute.name: borderWidth
attribute.description: The width of the border. Inidvidual border sides can be specified using borderWidthLeft, borderWidthRight, borderWidthTop and borderWidthBottom.

component.name: pageNumber
component.description: The current page number can be placed inside of a header or footer using the p:pageNumber tag. The page number tag can only be used in the context of a header or footer and can only be used once.
